Class UsageRecord

java.lang.Object
UsageRecord
public class UsageRecord extends Object
Represents a water usage record with date and amount information.

Semantics: Each instance captures a single day's (or reading's) usage in liters associated with a specific meter and date. The recordID is assigned from a class-level counter to provide a simple, increasing identifier.

Thread-safety: The static counter used to assign recordID (nextRecordID) is not synchronized. If records may be created from multiple threads, consider external synchronization or replacing the counter with an AtomicInteger to avoid duplicate IDs.

Immutability: recordID and meterID are set at construction and not exposed for mutation. The date and usageAmount fields can be updated via setters.

Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • UsageRecord

      public UsageRecord(String meterID, LocalDate date, double usageAmount)
      Creates a new usage record with an auto-assigned ID.
      Parameters:
      meterID - the water meter ID (must not be null in typical usage)
      date - the date of usage (e.g., the reading date)
      usageAmount - the amount of water used in liters
